Allbooks.author: George Orwell
Allbooks.overview: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society under constant surveillance.
Allbooks.description: The story of Winston Smith's fight against the Party's oppressive control.

Allbooks.author: Harper Lee
Allbooks.overview: A classic American novel exploring themes of racial injustice in the Deep South.
Allbooks.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
Allbooks.description: Scout Finch narrates her childhood experiences growing up in a racially divided town.

Allbooks.author: J.K. Rowling
Allbooks.overview: The first novel in the Harry Potter series, introducing Harry's journey into the wizarding world.
Allbooks.title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
Allbooks.description: Harry discovers his true identity as a wizard and attends Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

Allbooks.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Allbooks.overview: A novel that critiques the American Dream in the Jazz Age.
Allbooks.title: The Great Gatsby
Allbooks.description: Nick Carraway observes the mysterious life of his neighbor, Jay Gatsby.

Allbooks.author: Mary Shelley
Allbooks.overview: A Gothic novel about the tragic consequences of man's pursuit of knowledge.
Allbooks.title: Frankenstein
Allbooks.description: Victor Frankenstein creates a monster in his quest for scientific knowledge.

Allbooks.author: Herman Melville
Allbooks.overview: A tale of obsession and revenge, set in the world of whaling.
Allbooks.title: Moby-Dick
Allbooks.description: Captain Ahab seeks vengeance on the white whale that injured him.

Allbooks.author: Jane Austen
Allbooks.overview: A romance novel exploring the manners and matrimonial machinations of British society.
Allbooks.title: Pride and Prejudice
Allbooks.description: Elizabeth Bennet navigates society and her feelings for Mr. Darcy.

Allbooks.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Allbooks.overview: The first book in the epic Lord of the Rings trilogy.
Allbooks.title: The Fellowship of the Ring
Allbooks.description: Frodo Baggins embarks on a perilous journey to destroy the One Ring.

Allbooks.author: Mark Twain
Allbooks.publisher: Chatto & Windus / Charles L. Webster And Company
Allbooks.overview: A young boy's adventures on the Mississippi River, challenging societal norms.
Allbooks.title: Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
Allbooks.description: Huck Finn escapes his abusive father and travels with Jim, a runaway slave.

Allbooks.author: Leo Tolstoy
Allbooks.overview: A historical novel set during the Napoleonic Wars in Russia.
Allbooks.title: War and Peace
Allbooks.description: Explores the lives of various characters against the backdrop of Russian society.

Allbooks.author: Emily Brontë
Allbooks.overview: A dark tale of passion and revenge on the Yorkshire moors.
Allbooks.title: Wuthering Heights
Allbooks.description: The tempestuous love story of Heathcliff and Catherine Earnshaw.

Allbooks.author: Aldous Huxley
Allbooks.overview: A dystopian novel exploring a technologically advanced future society.
Allbooks.title: Brave New World
Allbooks.description: Examines the potential consequences of technological advancements on society.

Allbooks.author: Ernest Hemingway
Allbooks.overview: An epic story of struggle and perseverance by an old fisherman.
Allbooks.title: The Old Man and the Sea
Allbooks.description: Santiago battles a giant marlin in the Gulf Stream.

Allbooks.author: Kurt Vonnegut
Allbooks.overview: A satire of war, focusing on the bombing of Dresden during WWII.
Allbooks.title: Slaughterhouse-Five
Allbooks.description: Billy Pilgrim becomes unstuck in time and reflects on the horrors of war.

Allbooks.author: Gabriel García Márquez
Allbooks.overview: A magical realism novel following the Buendía family's generational story.
Allbooks.title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
Allbooks.description: Explores themes of love, power, and the cyclic nature of history.
